intro: Dichaetanthera altissima, commonly known as the tall dichaetanthera, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in panicles, typical of many grass species. Dichaetanthera altissima is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
